林鄭：無香港人罷工 只係暴徙塞路 造成好似罷工既畫面
連林鄭都笑鳩香港人

今日得小小塞車，最主要嘅幾條路同幾區完全冇事
中環同觀塘完全冇事
特別係中環佢超級重裝甲
全街都係龜
而且成條街感覺上冇乜同路人
而且尋日係邊度開花幾點開都冇Post 講清楚
唔同時間地點都有人講
我明你哋想出其不意
但係咁樣就變咗好少人可以出到黎

大家要明想保全手足
想罷工成功
係一定要大家被罷工，係全民停工！
始終好現實呢場仗好長
資金好重要
任何一個同路人俾人炒
就少咗一個資金來源

我唔同意大家咁快又搞多次罷工
一嚟完全冇準備好
老老實實
如果冇準備去搞交通
又好似今日咁
無啦啦犧牲左一班手足

阻塞交通呢啲嘢一個人好危險
但係一大班人一齊做
呢件事就會冇咁危險
我個人認為等多個禮拜
星期日晚真係全部人都要出嚟
盡量做
始終如果地鐵冇停駛
啲隧道完全唔塞
點停工

夜晚做嘢容易過朝早
夜晚可以多啲人出
反而朝早少啲人會出

我哋需要多啲時間做文宣同準備
依家越嚟越難
但係我哋都要加油
繼續撐落去
香港人反抗！

想睇下大家點睇

被肆意輪姦 槍殺，然後一切如常？

聽日唔可以只係想重覆今日嘅行動！
係同一時間集合
係同一地方堵路
以為咁，就足夠

因為今日，狗只係被我哋打左個措手不及
聽朝，佢哋唔會只係用同一樣的方法

佢哋會派更多便衣，軍車四圍巡
見到人，就會查
黑衫嘅，直接拉
可能再有其他方法
目的就係令到手足聚唔到人

所以呢，手足唔應該只係諗住做同今日一樣的事就夠

今日，一定要諗下狗會點做
今日，一定要諗好反制措施
今日，一定要諗下自己有咩要做

例如，我提議，手足應該以街坊裝落街視察下先，切勿一開始就 black block /帶文具，
因為聽日便衣數目分分鐘係今日嘅 double ，一定要小心
做到嘢先做，做唔到嘢就哨住，睇下風景
切勿被一定要做嘢嘅心態束縛而被捉
一定要有哨，有plan ，有撤退通路嘅情況下，先開波

絕對明白唔係個個都可以即刻dum低所有嘢，呢一刻你好嬲，但又唔知做咩好？

二百萬三罷聯合陣線將聯同各行業發起大規模行業行動，包括按章工作、不合作運動等，繼續為終極大三罷鋪路。第一批的六個界別包括IT界、社福界、設計界、航空界、教育界以及舞台界。我們呼籲各行各業響應不合作運動及按章工作，從明天（12/11）開始發起全面的行業行動，並於我們保持緊密聯繫。

1111開槍的故事
 
我係開槍事件嘅警察
我想喺呢度分享我嘅感受
 
首先我要多謝社會大眾、工會主席、一哥、特首、甚至國家俾我哋無限度永不割蓆嘅支持，而我哋有嘅係合法殺人都唔割嘅支持！
 
呢四個月我覺得好振奮，因為返工和收工我和夥計都可以打曱甴， 返工可以任我選擇我鍾意嘅武器去增壓、去打示威者，又有OT，有錢收去打曱甴爽到爆！休班仲俾埋警棍我哋用添，又可以賺OT、又可以立功，何樂而不為呢！
 
之前我哋嘅主席和發言人謝Sir已經講過邊個 object搶我哋啲支炮（第二生命）、或者令我哋感覺到生命受到威脅，（重點係我哋嘅感覺，感覺嘅嘢好主觀架）否則你哋「後果自負」！
 
一早收到消息，今日會有更恐怖更恐力嘅甴曱暴徒會搞事，今日我同夥計喺車度已經傾緊點樣打曱甴，傾到好興奮！一去到現場已經見到曱甴喺度封路，雖然現場冇人生命受到威脅，但我仍然主動拔槍上前驅趕，捉住一隻白衫曱甴，有隻曱甴竟然想用手搞我，我見到咁嘅情況，機會嚟啦飛雲。
 
呢個情況係電光火石！係電光火石！係電光火石！仲要生命受到威脅！生命受到威脅！生命受到威脅！重要嘅嘢講三次！
 
我即刻拎我從來冇用機會嘅左輪，當然唔係向天嗚槍啦，見到有隻曱甴竟然想用手攪我，唔係掛！你唔係講笑呀嘛？雖然佢已經停咗手，但電光火石之間，我仍然感到生命嚴重受到威脅，覺得隻曱甴會用手打死我，我即刻開槍！
 
跟住啲曱甴即刻散晒，見到嗰隻中槍嘅曱甴喺地下殿下殿下，不斷流血，我和夥計即刻撳住佢，急救？咪講笑啦！我哋仲要將佢反轉、搖來搖去添。
 
之後返到警署，每個夥計都同我講支持我！核爆都唔割嗰隻！全世界一定攬我！黃大仙同事，仲話開三槍嫌少添！「電光火石」係最強護盾，一出呢四個字直係殺人都得！估計今晚，詳細調查都未做，一哥一定出嚟攬我啦！話我開槍係合理合法！我感覺真係好良好！甚至我喺度諗，電光火石生命受到威脅嘅一刻，射頭又如何呢？
 
曲線要講明
故事純屬虛構
如有雷同實屬巧合

警甴 #蓄意謀殺 #不對等武力
拘捕是職責，
示威者只是封路，
而且在冇人生命受到威脅情況下，
主動拔槍走上前，
為咗拘捕一個進行不合作運動的示威者，而開槍殺人，誰更大罪？

依家路面好難玩呀，先唔講我地一班勇武手足比人拉左，已經係講緊和理非見到咁既情況之後都唔夠膽出黎。就算你（所有手足）出黎，佢（狗）依家都亂鳩咁拉人、亂咁開真槍，威脅好大！所以依家如果你話真係要大罷工呢，唔該！係唔夠人既情況，如果夠人梗係塞鳩佢老母啦（路面），屌佢老母！但係我地依家路面唔夠人嘛，唔該大家認認真真去搞呢個罷工！點樣搞？你係要塞佢個鐵、塞佢巴士，全世界上鳩去唔撚落車呀！我地二百鳩幾萬人，你同我講塞唔到？唔撚可能架其實。全部人上地鐵、上巴士，唔撚落車！就係咁簡單。
比d骨氣啦喂，呢d零成本，唔會比人拉架，d藍絲係埋入面架嘛，好似太子咁呀唔通？唔撚該啦大家！死左人啦、輪姦左人啦，輸緊啦......咁安全既零成本既野唔該大家都真係去做下啦！做得掂咪大家都唔洗返工囉！塞佢老母鐵呀！塞佢老母巴士呀！

荃灣警署強姦案女義士發聲明：

Criminal Investigation into Allegation of Rape inside Tsuen Wan Police Station. We represent Ms X, a young Hong Kong female who recently filed a criminal complaint alleging that she was raped by a number of police officers in Tsuen Wan Police Station. Ms X made her complaint to police in the expectation that it would be investigated with impartiality, in strict confidence, and with respect for her privacy and dignity. She has made no public comment about the case and has not sought publicity in any way. Unfortunately, the police investigating Ms X’s case appear to have systematically worked to discredit her and to undermine her complaint. Police have deliberately leaked supposed details of the case in a manner which any objective observer would be driven to conclude, were directed at publicly discrediting Ms X and diminishing any prospect of a successful prosecution. In light of the recent leaks and statements by the police, Ms X wishes us to issue the following statement. On a date in October 2019, Ms X took the courageous step of filing a report to police about her rape inside Tsuen Wan Police Station. She filed her report through the proper channels. She subsequently gave a detailed account of the events to police, answering extensive and highly invasive questions. As requested by police, she underwent a forensic medical examination. Ms X further underwent a termination of the ensuing pregnancy and has permitted the taking of a DNA sample from the aborted foetus to assist in identifying at least one of her assailants. Throughout the investigation, Ms X has repeatedly asked police for updates on the case but the investigating team has refused to provide her with any details whatsoever. On 4th November, 2019 Ms X learned that police had, without her knowledge or consent, obtained a search warrant to seize her private medical records, including those long pre-dating the allegations. The warrant also allowed police to seize CCTV footage from her private doctor’s clinic for a period of several days before and after the date of the alleged rape. The Hong Kong Police Force Victims’ Charter guarantees that the privacy and dignity of criminal complainants will be respected at all times. To seek to obtain a rape complainant’s private medical records without their knowledge and consent is a gross invasion of privacy. Such action was an outrageous abuse of police power. Ms X immediately went to court to challenge the search warrant. On the morning of 5th November 2019, the issuing magistrate, having been properly apprised of the facts, immediately suspended the search warrant. The Magistrate further granted an Anonymity Order, which prevents any person (including the press) from identifying Ms X, whether directly or indirectly. A breach of the Anonymity Order may amount to a contempt of Court. Over the past few days, Ms X has been deeply distressed to see alleged details of her case leak onto the internet. The Police Public Relations Bureau and unidentified ‘police sources’ have selectively released supposed details of the investigation, along with adverse comment on the evidence, in a way which any objective observer would be driven to conclude, were directed at publicly discrediting Ms X and diminishing any prospect of a successful prosecution. Ms X considers that any attempt by police to publicly discredit a rape victim and adversely comment on evidence in an on-going investigation is despicable and offensive. Such attempts should be condemned in the strongest terms. Unsurprisingly, Ms X has formed the view that the Hong Kong police force cannot be trusted to impartially investigate her allegations or indeed any criminal complaints relating to police officers. Ms X demands that the police immediately cease the unlawful and grossly unprofessional leaking of information and comment about her case. She asks for her privacy to be respected.
